pr_title: [RW-4360][risk=no] Create tool to load institutional affiliations from a file

timeline.message: create tool to load initial set of institutitons

timeline.bodyText: It can be helpful to have an example file and refer to it from here, e.g. "see /path/to/examples/institutions.json". These would need to be fake/anonymous.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: thinking out loud, but I wonder if it wouldn't be easier for the Ruby layer to build a JSON object of the options and just pass them to Java as one chunk. No need to change this now though.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Hmm, that would make the gradle commands pretty unwieldy if they're used without project.rb.
replies.author: ericsong

timeline.bodyText: nit: with builders, I like to see them instantiated inline unless we've got conditionals happening or they're more than a couple of levels deep. I'd inline your two option vars into this declaration.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: do you want to check if props have changed here? Even if you don't want to upsert, it's good to know.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
